sen.j: 下毛野 多具比（しもつけぬ の たぐひ、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: SHIMOTSUKENU no Taguhi (year of birth and death unknown) was a noble who lived during Nara period.
SHIMOTSUKENU no Taguhi (year of birth and death unknown) was a noble who lived during Nara period.
SHIMOTSUKENU no Taguhi (year of birth and death unknown) was a noble who lived during Nara period.
His main name was SHIMOTSUKENU no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His main name was SHIMOTSUKENU no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles).
His main name was SHIMOTSUKENU no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 右馬頭に任ぜられるなど、武官としても重用された。
sen.e: He was appointed to a responsible post as a military officer such as Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).
He was appointed to a responsible post as a military officer such as Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).
He was appointed to a responsible post as a military officer such as Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).

tit.e: Record of offices and ranks held
Record of offices and ranks held
Record of offices and ranks held

sen.j: 750年（天平勝宝2年）1月16日 (旧暦) - 正六位上だった多具比は孝謙天皇より従五位下を下賜される。
sen.e: On March 2, 750, Taguhi who had been Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by the Empress Koken.
On March 2, 750 or January 16 on the old calendar, Taguhi who had been Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by the Empress Koken.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦を併記しました。
sen.e: On March 2, 750, Taguhi who had been Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) was granted Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by the Empress Koken.

sen.j: 757年（天平宝字元年）6月16日 (旧暦) - 孝謙天皇より右馬頭に任ぜられる。
sen.e: Appointed to Uma no kami by the Empress Koken on July 10, 757.
Appointed to Uma no kami by the Empress Koken on July 10, 757 or June 16 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦を併記しました。
sen.e: Appointed to Uma no kami by the Empress Koken on July 10, 757.

sen.j: 764年（天平宝字8年）1月7日 (旧暦) - 淳仁天皇より従五位上を下賜される。
sen.e: Granted Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by the Emperor Junnin on February 17, 764.
Granted Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by the Emperor Junnin on February 17, 764 or January 7 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦を併記しました。
sen.e: Granted Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) by the Emperor Junnin on February 17, 764.

sen.j: 764年（天平宝字8年）10月20日 (旧暦) - 淳仁天皇より遠江国守に任ぜられる。
sen.e: Appointed to Totomi no kuni no kami (Governor of Totomi Province) by the Emperor Junnin on November 21, 764.
Appointed to Totomi no kuni no kami (Governor of Totomi Province) by the Emperor Junnin on November 21, 764 or October 20 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・念のため旧暦を併記しました。
sen.e: Appointed to Totomi no kuni no kami (Governor of Totomi Province) by the Emperor Junnin on November 21, 764.
